@DynamicAttrs Class for storing collective variables and parameters used in biased simulations

String specifying biasfactor in PLUMED input file

String containing names of all collective variables separated by commas

property from_file: boolÔÉÅ

Whether the bias is initialised using PLUMED input file

initialise_for_metad_al(width: Sequence[float] | float, pace: int = 20, height: float | None = None, biasfactor: float | None = None, cvs: Optional = None, grid_min: Sequence[float] | float = None, grid_max: Sequence[float] | float = None, grid_bin: Sequence[float] | float = None) → NoneÔÉÅ

Initialise PlumedBias for metadynamics active learning by setting the required parameters.

Parameters:

  • pace ‚Äì (int) œÑ_G/dt, interval at which a new gaussian is placed

  • height ‚Äì (float) œâ, initial height of placed gaussians (in eV). If not supplied will be set to 5*k_B*T, where T is the temperature at which metadynamics active learning is performed

  • biasfactor ‚Äì (float) Œ≥, describes how quickly gaussians shrink, larger values make gaussians to be placed less sensitive to the bias potential

  • cvs ‚Äì (mlptrain._PlumedCV) Sequence of PLUMED collective variables which will be biased. If this variable is not set, all CVs attached to self will be biased

  • grid_min ‚Äì (float) Lower bound of the grid

  • grid_max ‚Äì (float) Upper bound of the grid

  • grid_bin ‚Äì (float) Number of bins to use for each collective variable, if not specified PLUMED automatically sets bin width to 1/5 of the gaussian width (œÉ) value

property metad_cv_sequence: strÔÉÅ

String containing names of collective variables used in metadynamics separated by commas

property metad_grid_setup: strÔÉÅ

String specifying metadynamics grid parameters in PLUMED input file

property metadynamics: boolÔÉÅ

True if any parameters required for metadynamics are set

property n_cvs: intÔÉÅ

Number of collective variables attached to the bias

property n_metad_cvs: intÔÉÅ

Number of collective variables attached to the bias that will be used in metadynamics

strip() → NoneÔÉÅ

Change the bias such that it would only contain the definitions of collective variables and their associated upper and lower walls

String containing width values separated by commas

class mlptrain.sampling.plumed.PlumedCalculator(calc, input, timestep, atoms=None, kT=1.0, log='', restart=False, use_charge=False, update_charge=False)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Plumed

Modified ASE calculator, instead of returning biased energies and forces, this calculator computes unbiased energies and forces, and computes PLUMED energy and force biases separately.

calculate(atoms=None, properties=['energy', 'forces', 'energy_bias', 'forces_bias'], system_changes=['positions', 'numbers', 'cell', 'pbc', 'initial_charges', 'initial_magmoms']) → NoneÔÉÅ

Compute the properties and attach them to the results

Compute unbiased energies and forces, and PLUMED energy and force biases separately

mlptrain.sampling.plumed.plot_cv1_and_cv2(filenames: Sequence[str], style: str = 'scatter', cvs_units: Sequence[str] | None = None, cvs_limits: Sequence[Sequence[float]] | None = None, label: str | None = None) → NoneÔÉÅ

Plot the trajectory of the system by tracking two collective variables using two colvar files. The function only works for two collective variables.

‚Äòhistogram‚Äô

Parameters:

  • cvs_units ‚Äì Units of the CVs to be plotted

  • cvs_limits ‚Äì Min and max limits of the CVs in the plot

  • label ‚Äì (str) Label attached to the name of the plot, useful when multiple plots of the same CVs are generated in the same directory

mlptrain.sampling.plumed.plot_cv_versus_time(filename: str, style: str = 'trajectory', time_units: str = 'ps', cv_units: str | None = None, cv_limits: Sequence[float] | None = None, label: str | None = None) → NoneÔÉÅ

Plot a collective variable as a function of time from a given colvar file. Only plot the first collective variable in the colvar file.

Parameters:

  • time_units ‚Äì (str) Units of time

  • cv_units ‚Äì Units of the CV to be plotted

  • cv_limits ‚Äì Min and max limits of the CV in the plot

  • label ‚Äì (str) Label attached to the name of the plot, useful when multiple plots of the same CVs are generated in the same directory
